recommended_treatment: Vaginal brachytherapy with or without external beam pelvic radiotherapy
description: High-grade endometrioid adenocarcinoma (FIGO grade III) measuring 4.0 x 3.8 x 1.3 cm with minimal (<1 mm) myometrial invasion, no cervical involvement, negative lymph nodes (pT1a pN0), and negative margins.
patient_notes: Your pathology report shows a type of endometrial cancer that was removed completely and confined to the uterus with only minimal invasion. No lymph node involvement was found. Based on the tumor’s high-grade features, further therapy such as radiation to the pelvis, possibly with vaginal treatment and/or chemotherapy, may be recommended. Your treatment team will discuss these options and support you through the next steps.

verification.assessment: Treatment recommendation overstates systemic therapy; NCCN guidelines for stage IA grade 3 LVSI-negative endometrioid adenocarcinoma recommend vaginal brachytherapy ± pelvic EBRT without routine chemotherapy.

recommended_treatment.issues: Includes systemic therapy which is not recommended for FIGO IA grade 3 LVSI-negative endometrioid adenocarcinoma per NCCN guidelines.

change_explanations.recommended_treatment: Changed from 'Systemic therapy with or without external beam radiotherapy and vaginal brachytherapy, or external beam radiotherapy with or without vaginal brachytherapy' to 'Vaginal brachytherapy with or without external beam pelvic radiotherapy'. Reason: Includes systemic therapy which is not recommended for FIGO IA grade 3 LVSI-negative endometrioid adenocarcinoma per NCCN guidelines.
